predictions.rationale: Shows generally correct probability reasoning (including without-replacement vs with-replacement) and even self-corrects one case, but has a notable mistake on the die probability and some inconsistency before settling on the right approach.

The student uses key genetics vocabulary correctly (genes/alleles, genotype vs phenotype, meiosis vs mitosis, homologous chromosomes, crossing-over) and gives mostly accurate explanations with only minor uncertainty about terms.
Student correctly applies mole concept, stoichiometric ratios, limiting reactant logic, leftover amounts, mass conversion, and percent yield with only minor uncertainty on one intermediate question.

Student gives mostly correct definitions and relationships (v=fλ, amplitude vs pitch, interference, harmonics) and applies them to new cases with appropriate terminology and a clarifying question, with no fundamental misconceptions.

The student accurately explains population distribution vs density, gives multiple physical and human factors with plausible policy applications, and shows good metacognitive awareness about map/average misinterpretations with only minor language uncertainty.
Gives mostly accurate core facts and a reasonable causal explanation with some uncertainty and minor confusion (e.g., mixing economic crises/terms) but can still connect ideas and self-correct.

The student shows partial understanding with some correct character/plot points and a reasonable inference about the doctor, but is often unsure, confuses key terms (e.g., drama structure/turning point), and needs significant support.

Shows some correct plate-boundary ideas (subduction, transform faults, S-waves) but has major misconceptions about Earth's interior (mantle as a lava ocean) and gives uncertain, distracted explanations.

The student correctly explains key circulation concepts (arteries/veins direction, double circulation path, oxygenation, pressure differences between heart sides) and self-corrects misconceptions with reasonable causal reasoning, with only minor informal/vague phrasing.

The student can apply the Pythagorean theorem and check a 7-24-25 triple, but shows confusion and guessing about acute/obtuse criteria and makes unsupported claims, indicating a fragile understanding.

Shows some basic ideas (friction, action–reaction pairs) but repeatedly holds the misconception that a continuing forward force is needed to keep motion and that the push force stays “in” the object, indicating fragile understanding.
Shows mostly correct core ideas about atomic number, periods/groups, electron counts and ion charge, but has some confusion about stability/octet reasoning and needs clarification on configurations.
Der Schüler kann mit Hinweisen die Steigung aus zwei Punkten berechnen und versucht b zu bestimmen, macht aber wiederholt Vorzeichen- und Rechenfehler und ist insgesamt unsicher/abgelenkt.

Shows solid, mostly accurate understanding with correct key concepts and dates, asks thoughtful transfer questions, and can explain causal links (e.g., Zollverein → larger market → investment/industrial growth) with only minor oversimplifications.

Shows some basic ideas (Ohm’s law, series vs. parallel) but has repeated fundamental misconceptions about parallel circuits (voltage/current splitting, resistance intuition) and needs significant guidance to correct them.

The student gives accurate, specific explanations (Ancien Régime, Estates, Parlements/remonstrance), applies evidence to an argument, and shows strong metacognitive awareness about exam structure with only minor uncertainty.

The student correctly applies Brønsted–Lowry and conjugate-pair reasoning across multiple reactions, shows metacognitive awareness of uncertainty, and makes only minor conceptual slips/confusions about relative base strength.

The student accurately explains thesis/counterargument/rebuttal structure, applies it in coherent examples, and shows strong metacognitive questioning with only minor uncertainty about exam-specific conventions.
The student correctly applies the pq-formula, understands the discriminant cases, and can use Vieta/factoring with some uncertainty and sign/format confusion but no fundamental misconceptions.

The student gives mostly correct explanations and classifications (ionic vs covalent, octet rule, electronegativity trends, polarity ordering) and shows strong metacognition by checking group numbers and asking how to justify answers beyond memorized rules.

Der Schüler nutzt zentrale Fachbegriffe korrekt (z.B. lyrisches Ich, Reimschema, Stimmung) und kann Textbelege zu einer plausiblen Deutung verknüpfen, wirkt aber noch unsicher und sucht nach festen „Formeln“ statt eigenständig zu begründen.

The student uses mostly correct plate-tectonics vocabulary and mechanisms (subduction, convection, slab pull, ductile asthenosphere) and asks insightful follow-up questions that transfer to deeper mantle processes, with only minor simplifications.

The student gives mostly accurate, connected explanations of circulation, pressure, valves, bruising, and edema while asking thoughtful follow-up questions, with only minor uncertainty about specific valve names/biochemistry order.

Der Schüler nutzt den Satz des Pythagoras korrekt in Beispielen (inkl. Wurzelziehen und Umkehrung), erklärt Begriffe wie Hypotenuse richtig und zeigt Transfer/Neugier (Verallgemeinerung auf andere Formen), mit nur kleinen Unsicherheiten beim Rechnen.

Shows solid conceptual understanding of Newton’s laws (inertia, net force at constant velocity, normal force in an accelerating elevator) with good transfer and curiosity, though makes a sign/direction mistake about when N is greater vs smaller than mg.

The student correctly explains periodic trends using effective nuclear charge, shielding, and valence electrons, applies ideas to new comparisons, and shows metacognitive awareness of electron–electron repulsion confusion without major misconceptions.

The student correctly computes slopes/intercepts and forms line equations with clear explanations and shows strong curiosity/transfer (e.g., parallel lines and curved space), with no evident fundamental misconceptions.

Zeigt überwiegend sichere, textnahe Kenntnisse (Pakt/Wette, Schlüsselzitat, Gretchen-Szenen) und kann Motive/Deutung übertragen, auch wenn einzelne Aussagen teils vereinfachend und umgangssprachlich bleiben.
